div.h2: Mexia ISD Schools Closed through May 21
div.p: In accordance with Governor Abbottâ€™s executive order, Mexia ISDâ€™s buildings will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.Â All Mexia ISD events scheduled through the end of the year are canceled. While we believe this extended closure is in the best interest of public health and our community, we recognize the significant impact it will have, especially for families who depend on the district for critical services.

While our classrooms are empty, our work on behalf of students continues. All teachers are preparing lessons for distance learning using online tools or printed packets of materials. They will continue to be in contact with you and your students to provide lessons, feedback on student work returned and assistance throughout the closure. Our district office will be open 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. each day with limited staff to answer phone calls and provide printed instruction packets for those who need them. Packaged meals for all MISD students will be available for pick-up each weekday, 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m., at our R. Q. Sims Intermediate canopy line and limited delivery will continue as well. Meals are available to all students.
Families may pick up packets on Mondays at each campus from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 4:30 p.m. to 5:30 p.m. Information will also be posted on each campusâ€™s website.
Mexia ISD will continue to provide posts and updated information to this web page.
